CAREER SUMMARY  
 
October  2019 to date  Ritherdon & Co Ltd  
Position: Technical Support Engineer  
• CAD design – GA drawings of our products  for customers , and design and  
manufacture of testing equipment  used to expand the company knowledge 
base.  
• Conducted testing to evaluate the physical and thermodynamic performance of 
the company ’s products to identify development opportunities . 
• Created detailed datasheets/installation guides for our entire product range 
centra lising  all relevant technical information, increasing productivity  of 
technical and sales departments.  
• Writing  Approval In Principle (AIP) documents for approval of our products by 
National Highways . 
• Exposure to lean manufacturing methods such as 5S , to design in such a way 
as to optimise  manufacture . 
• Organised and managed external testing of our products with TIC service 
providers.  
• Developed communication skills through hosting meetings with customers and 
extensive customer facing work.  
• Relaying technical information on our products to  a variety of audiences.  
• Programming Web Chat AI to automate responses to FAQs, saving the 
technical and sales departments time.  
 
  
    
July 2017 to July 2018  Fiber Lean™ Technologies Ltd  
Position: Process Development  
• Develop ed a new sustainable FiberLean™ Multi Fibrillated Cellulose (MFC)  
product  made using recycled waste materials  used to reduce raw material 
requirements  during paper manufacture and improve physical properties.  
• Conduct ed pilot scale testing of a new separation technology with the aim of 
reducing capital and operational expenditure  by 50% , then  travelled to Sweden 
to conduct  scale -up testing with a vendor .  
• Trained in the operation of new industrial equipment and used it t o perform 
experiments  aiming to reduce the cost and environmental impact of 
international product transport . 
• Undertook night shifts to collaborate  in large -scale company trials achieving  a 
30% product throughput increase.  
• Applied  industrial risk management and reduction  techniques  including  LOTO 
and Reg ulation  12.  
• Performed lab testing to determine the tensile strength, particle size distribution 
and composition  of samples.   
• Generated detailed investigative reports and delivered presentations  to diverse 
audiences.  
 
2016/2017 & 2018/2019 Academic Year s: Peer Mentoring  Scheme  
• Gave  advice and one -on-one support to undergraduate  students . 
• Delivered  workshops aimed at  giving first year students the tools to work in 
groups effectively . 
 
April – September 2016: Volunteering at RSPCA Rawtenstall  
• Relied upon to perform multiple roles within the shop  to keep the business 
running , including  operating the  cash register,  communicating with customers, 
steaming and hanging clothes,  and sorting and organising donations .  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
He is a prize-winning graduate Chemical E ngineering MEng student  with industrial 
placement experience planning  to begin a career in the process engineering industry  
after time spent in the manufacturing industry . Key skills developed in product 
development, pilot-scale/scale -up testing, plant modelling using Excel and HYSYS , 
and AutoCAD design .  
 
Achievements and Interests  
• Received  BP Prize s for first three years  – Top 20 performing students 1st Year 
and Top 10 in 2nd, 3rd & 4th Years. 
• Awarded High -Fliers certificate at the end of 2nd year – Top 5% achievers in 
Faculty of Engineering . 
• Micro soft Office Specialist (MOS) Excel 2016 Expert  Certification . 
• Member of IChemE  since 2014 . 
• Proficient in French (1 4 years)  - received the J.E. Macleroy Foreign Languages 
award at AS Level . 
• Full Clean UK Driving License .
